item.title: Open sourcing ROS 2 Task Manager package
item.dc:creator: Janne Karttunen
item.description: We are proud to announce the open-sourcing of our Task Manager ROS 2 package, a centralized solution designed to initiate, monitor, […]
item.content:encoded:
We are proud to announce the open-sourcing of our Task Manager ROS 2 package, a centralized solution designed to initiate, monitor, and manage tasks on a single robot. By making this package publicly available, we aim to assist the robotics community in addressing current challenges related to robot task management.

Source

item.title: ROS 2 common issues and mistakes
item.dc:creator: Janne Karttunen
item.description: After years of experience of working with ROS and robotics, we’ve seen a fair share of weird and surprising bugs […]
item.content:encoded:
After years of experience of working with ROS and robotics, we’ve seen a fair share of weird and surprising bugs and issues. I wanted to share our experiences by writing this article about some of the most common issues we encounter and how we solve and debug them while developing robots with ROS 2. Many of these issues might be difficult to spot or find a reason for during normal debugging…

Source

item.title: Using Gazebo for Reinforcement Learning
item.dc:creator: Janne Karttunen
item.description: The world is highly complex. To operate in this complex world with self-driving robots, it would be hard to program […]
item.content:encoded:
The world is highly complex. To operate in this complex world with self-driving robots, it would be hard to program all the tasks by hand, creating rules for every subtask and action. We humans can complete really complex tasks just by setting for ourselves the final goal for what we are supposed to do. For example, just by telling someone to “paint a wall”, they will know where to search to…

Source
